description: The issue arises from a use-after-free vulnerability in the Blink component of Chromium, specifically related to its history management. This flaw allows an attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code in the context of the browser, leading to serious security implications. The vulnerability is present in Chromium versions prior to 118.0.2088.46, which is the version ingested by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This security update effectively remediates the flaw, ensuring that users of the specified build are protected against exploitation. The vulnerability was documented under CVE-2023-5476, which helps Microsoft experts trace the root of this issue in future assessments. Relevant KB Article ID is KB-118.0.2088.46.
